titleStmt.title: Letter May 21, 254 BC (docketed on the 22nd)
titleStmt.author: Apollonios, dioiketes, 12 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p.292-293

msContents.summary: Fragmentary letter of Apollonios to Zenon about unsatisfactory conditions in the beer-brewing concession at Philadelphia: he is placing a different person in charge of the brewery

msItemStruct.note: Written across the fibers with 10 lines; on the back, along the fibers, the docket is preserved
Chancery hand of the bureau of Apollonios; it is particularly large with letters up to 2 cm.; one addition over the line

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in December 1926; no. 134 in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Apollonios (to Zenon, greeting. Arrest the former treasurer) of the beer- selling concession.--- [statement about Ammeneus] -- For he has lied in the statement that ---- laid hands upon him. Write to me in order that (I may know what Pais [?] has said) and that I may send a counter- statement to you about him. Until I arrive to discuss these matters, place him in charge of the brewery and order him to go to work and to give his attention to all matters relating to the shop. Good-bye. Year 31, Dystros 21, (Phamenoth 28)
